appleName: Diamond Shape with a Dot Inside

components.appleName: Diamond Shape with a Dot Inside
components.description:
A glyph that is used for kawaii in Japan, resembling the shape of a flower.

Google's design previously resembled a flower, while Samsung's previously displayed a white symbol on a blue square.

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.
components.title: Diamond Shape with a Dot Inside

title: Diamond Shape with a Dot Inside

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Comic style symbols

emoji_net_data.name: diamond with a dot

bn:00037606n: An attractive mineral used for adornments
Piece of mineral used to make jewelry
A crystalline rock that can be cut and polished for jewelry
Any gem, such as a diamond or ruby, that is expensive because of its rarity or desirability; especially one set into a piece of jewelry.
A small piece of stone, a pebble.
A gemstone or gem is a piece of crystal, which, in cut and polished form, is used to make jewelry or other adornments.
A valuable stone that has been cut and polished and is used in jewellery.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the diamond with a dot emoji presents a perfectly cut gemstone with a brilliant, clear facet that catches the light. The surrounding diamond shape is rendered with glossy 3D shading and soft rounded edges, giving it an opulent and luxurious feel, a hallmark of Apple's design. This emoji symbolizes precision, clarity, or a central point of focus, often used to highlight an important detail or a gem of an idea.
